segment.source: Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM
segment.target: Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM

segment.source: Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM
segment.target: Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM

segment.source: Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM
segment.target: Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM

segment.source: You can upgrade Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) to MBAM 2.0, with the Stand-alone topology or Configuration Manager topology, by doing the following:
segment.target: You can upgrade Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) to MBAM 2.0, with the Stand-alone topology or Configuration Manager topology, by doing the following:

segment.source: Manual in-place server replacement – To upgrade the MBAM Server, manually uninstall MBAM by using either the installer or Control Panel, and then install the MBAM 2.0 infrastructure.
segment.target: Manual in-place server replacement – To upgrade the MBAM Server, manually uninstall MBAM by using either the installer or Control Panel, and then install the MBAM 2.0 infrastructure.

segment.source: You do not have to remove the databases.
segment.target: You do not have to remove the databases.

segment.source: Uninstalling the MBAM 1.0 Server leaves the MBAM databases intact.
segment.target: Uninstalling the MBAM 1.0 Server leaves the MBAM databases intact.

segment.source: If you specify the same databases that MBAM 1.0 was using, the MBAM 2.0 installation retains MBAM 1.0 data in the databases and converts the databases to work with MBAM 2.0.
segment.target: If you specify the same databases that MBAM 1.0 was using, the MBAM 2.0 installation retains MBAM 1.0 data in the databases and converts the databases to work with MBAM 2.0.

segment.source: Distributed Client Upgrade - If you are using the Stand-alone MBAM topology, you can upgrade the MBAM Clients gradually after you install the MBAM 2.0 Server infrastructure.
segment.target: Distributed Client Upgrade - If you are using the Stand-alone MBAM topology, you can upgrade the MBAM Clients gradually after you install the MBAM 2.0 Server infrastructure.

segment.source: The MBAM 2.0 Server detects the version of the existing Client and performs the required steps to upgrade to the 2.0 Client.
segment.target: The MBAM 2.0 Server detects the version of the existing Client and performs the required steps to upgrade to the 2.0 Client.

segment.source: After you upgrade the MBAM 2.0 Server infrastructure, MBAM 1.0 Clients continue to report to the MBAM 2.0 Server successfully, escrowing recovery data, but compliance will be based on the policies in MBAM 1.0.
segment.target: After you upgrade the MBAM 2.0 Server infrastructure, MBAM 1.0 Clients continue to report to the MBAM 2.0 Server successfully, escrowing recovery data, but compliance will be based on the policies in MBAM 1.0.

segment.source: You must upgrade clients to MBAM 2.0 to have client computers accurately report compliance against the MBAM 2.0 policies.
segment.target: You must upgrade clients to MBAM 2.0 to have client computers accurately report compliance against the MBAM 2.0 policies.

segment.source: You can upgrade the clients to the MBAM 2.0 Client without uninstalling the previous client, and the client will start to apply and report MBAM 2.0 policies.
segment.target: You can upgrade the clients to the MBAM 2.0 Client without uninstalling the previous client, and the client will start to apply and report MBAM 2.0 policies.

segment.source: If you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must upgrade the MBAM 1.0 clients to MBAM 2.0.
segment.target: If you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must upgrade the MBAM 1.0 clients to MBAM 2.0.

segment.source: Upgrading MBAM from a Two-Server Architecture
segment.target: Upgrading MBAM from a Two-Server Architecture

segment.source: Use the following instructions to upgrade from a previous version of MBAM when you are using a two-server architecture, where one server is hosting the Microsoft SQL Server components, and the other server is hosting the websites and services.
segment.target: Use the following instructions to upgrade from a previous version of MBAM when you are using a two-server architecture, where one server is hosting the Microsoft SQL Server components, and the other server is hosting the websites and services.

segment.source: To upgrade MBAM from a two-server architecture
segment.target: To upgrade MBAM from a two-server architecture

segment.source: On the server with the SQL Server features, in Control Panel, select Programs and Features, and then uninstall Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On the server with the SQL Server features, in Control Panel, select Programs and Features, and then uninstall Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: The Recovery Database and Compliance and Audit database remain unchanged.
segment.target: The Recovery Database and Compliance and Audit database remain unchanged.

segment.source: Run MBAMSetup.exe for version MBAM 2.0, optionally select the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Start.
segment.target: Run MBAMSetup.exe for version MBAM 2.0, optionally select the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Start.

segment.source: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.
segment.target: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.

segment.source: On the Topology Selection page, select the Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Topology Selection page, select the Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select features to install page, clear the Self-Service Server and Administration and Monitoring Server features, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select features to install page, clear the Self-Service Server and Administration and Monitoring Server features, and then click Next.

segment.source: Wait for the prerequisite checks to finish, and then click Next.
segment.target: Wait for the prerequisite checks to finish, and then click Next.

segment.source: If a missing prerequisite is detected, resolve the missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: If a missing prerequisite is detected, resolve the missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: On the Provide account used to access the MBAM databases page, provide the computer name for the server that will host the sites and services, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Provide account used to access the MBAM databases page, provide the computer name for the server that will host the sites and services, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure the Recovery database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the recovery data.
segment.target: On the Configure the Recovery database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the recovery data.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database files and log information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database files and log information will be located.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the compliance and audit data.
segment.target: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the compliance and audit data.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Reports page, specify the SQL Server Reporting Services instance where the Compliance and Audit reports will be installed, and provide a domain user account and password to access the Compliance and Audit database.
segment.target: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Reports page, specify the SQL Server Reporting Services instance where the Compliance and Audit reports will be installed, and provide a domain user account and password to access the Compliance and Audit database.

segment.source: Configure the password for this account to never expire.
segment.target: Configure the password for this account to never expire.

segment.source: The user account can access all data available to the MBAM Reports Users group.
segment.target: The user account can access all data available to the MBAM Reports Users group.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.

segment.source: This does not turn on Automatic Updates in Windows.
segment.target: This does not turn on Automatic Updates in Windows.

segment.source: If you previously chose to use Microsoft Update for this product or another product, the Microsoft Update page does not appear.
segment.target: If you previously chose to use Microsoft Update for this product or another product, the Microsoft Update page does not appear.

segment.source: On the Installation Summary page, review the features that will be installed, and then click Install to start the installation.
segment.target: On the Installation Summary page, review the features that will be installed, and then click Install to start the installation.

segment.source: To uninstall the Administration and Monitoring Server features and to complete the upgrade
segment.target: To uninstall the Administration and Monitoring Server features and to complete the upgrade

segment.source: On the computer that hosts the Administration and Monitoring Server features, in Control Panel, select Programs and Features, and then uninstall MBAM to remove the previously installed websites and services.
segment.target: On the computer that hosts the Administration and Monitoring Server features, in Control Panel, select Programs and Features, and then uninstall MBAM to remove the previously installed websites and services.

segment.source: Run the MBAMSetup.exe for version 2.0, optionally select the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Start.
segment.target: Run the MBAMSetup.exe for version 2.0, optionally select the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Start.

segment.source: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.
segment.target: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.

segment.source: On the Topology Selection page, select the Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Topology Selection page, select the Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select features to install page, clear the Recovery Database and Compliance and Audit Database and Compliance and Audit Reports features, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select features to install page, clear the Recovery Database and Compliance and Audit Database and Compliance and Audit Reports features, and then click Next.

segment.source: Wait for the prerequisite checks to finish, and then click Next.
segment.target: Wait for the prerequisite checks to finish, and then click Next.

segment.source: If a missing prerequisite is detected, resolve the missing prerequisites first, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: If a missing prerequisite is detected, resolve the missing prerequisites first, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: On the Configure network communication security page, choose whether to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL) encryption for the websites and services.
segment.target: On the Configure network communication security page, choose whether to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL) encryption for the websites and services.

segment.source: If you decide to encrypt the communication, select the certification authority (CA) certificate to use for encryption.
segment.target: If you decide to encrypt the communication, select the certification authority (CA) certificate to use for encryption.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The certificate must be created before this step to enable you to select it on this page.
segment.target: The certificate must be created before this step to enable you to select it on this page.

segment.source: On the Configure the location of the Compliance Status database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that stores the compliance and audit data.
segment.target: On the Configure the location of the Compliance Status database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that stores the compliance and audit data.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database files and log information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database files and log information will be located.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Configure the location of the Recovery Database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that stores the recovery data.
segment.target: On the Configure the location of the Recovery Database page, specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that stores the recovery data.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Reports page, enter the URL for the reporting instance that you configured on the other server.
segment.target: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Reports page, enter the URL for the reporting instance that you configured on the other server.

segment.source: Use the Test button to verify that you can reach the site.
segment.target: Use the Test button to verify that you can reach the site.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Configure the Self-Service Portal page, enter the port number, host name, virtual directory name, and installation path for the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: On the Configure the Self-Service Portal page, enter the port number, host name, virtual directory name, and installation path for the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring Server unless you specify a unique host header name.
segment.target: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring Server unless you specify a unique host header name.

segment.source: On the Configure the Administration and Monitoring Server page, specify the desired virtual directory for the Help Desk website.
segment.target: On the Configure the Administration and Monitoring Server page, specify the desired virtual directory for the Help Desk website.

segment.source: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.

segment.source: This step does not turn on Automatic Updates in Windows.
segment.target: This step does not turn on Automatic Updates in Windows.

segment.source: If you previously chose to use Microsoft Update for this product or another product, the Microsoft Update page does not appear.
segment.target: If you previously chose to use Microsoft Update for this product or another product, the Microsoft Update page does not appear.

segment.source: On the Installation Summary page, review the features that will be installed, and then click Install to start the installation.
segment.target: On the Installation Summary page, review the features that will be installed, and then click Install to start the installation.

segment.source: To validate that the upgrade was successful, verify that you can reach each site from another computer in the domain.
segment.target: To validate that the upgrade was successful, verify that you can reach each site from another computer in the domain.

segment.source: Upgrading the MBAM Client on End-User Computers
segment.target: Upgrading the MBAM Client on End-User Computers

segment.source: To upgrade end-user computers to the MBAM 2.0 Client, run MbamClientSetup.exe on each client computer.
segment.target: To upgrade end-user computers to the MBAM 2.0 Client, run MbamClientSetup.exe on each client computer.

segment.source: The installer automatically updates the Client to the MBAM 2.0 Client.
segment.target: The installer automatically updates the Client to the MBAM 2.0 Client.

segment.source: You can install the MBAM Client through an electronic software distribution system, tools such as Active Directory Domain Services or System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: You can install the MBAM Client through an electronic software distribution system, tools such as Active Directory Domain Services or System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: To validate the Client upgrade, do the following:
segment.target: To validate the Client upgrade, do the following:

segment.source: Wait until the configured reporting cycle is finished, and then start SQL Server Management Studio on the SQL Server computer.
segment.target: Wait until the configured reporting cycle is finished, and then start SQL Server Management Studio on the SQL Server computer.

segment.source: On the SQL Server computer, start SQL Server Management Studio.
segment.target: On the SQL Server computer, start SQL Server Management Studio.

segment.source: Verify that the RecoveryAndHardwareCore.Machines table contains a row that shows the end-user’s computer name.
segment.target: Verify that the RecoveryAndHardwareCore.Machines table contains a row that shows the end-user’s computer name.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Deploying MBAM 2.0
segment.target: Deploying MBAM 2.0
